column4: BIOS question: Can a SATA drive be set to h0 Master when there's an IDE drive present?
there is "master" in SATA.  You just setup grub to boot your sata disc and install]
er i meant there is no master in sata

Okay, so does it matter that my old IDE drive is h0 in the BIOS and SDA in my Ubuntu setup? It's empty. The problem is that whenever I have a kernel upgrade, I have to go into /boot/grub/menu.lst and change it up to get Ubuntu to load.
